docs.snippet: BOSSINGER--Julia Irene, (Bass), 90, of Monroe Twp.,NJ on Friday, November 29th, 2013. Alumna of Hunter College. Mother of the late Fred Stein. Survived by brother Saul Bass and family, daughters: Deborah Staska and Stephanie Crease, six grandchild...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSSINGER--Julia Irene, (Bass), 90, of Monroe Twp.,NJ on Friday, November 29th, 2013. Alumna of Hunter College. Mother of the late Fred Stein. Survived by brother Saul Bass and family, daughters: Deborah Staska and Stephanie Crease, six grandchildren, three great-grandchildren. Graveside service at Locust Valley Cemetery, NY, December 3 at 12:30pm.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BOSSINGER, JULIA IRENE, (BASS), 90, OF MONROE TWP.

docs.snippet: BENENSON--Mark K.,84, of New York City and Port Murray New Jersey, died November 27 2013. He is survived by his son Alexander, his daughter Daniela Fifi, and was predeceased last year by his wife, artist Letizia Pitigliani. Mark, once called the o...
docs.lead_paragraph: BENENSON--Mark K.,84, of New York City and Port Murray New Jersey, died November 27 2013. He is survived by his son Alexander, his daughter Daniela Fifi, and was predeceased last year by his wife, artist Letizia Pitigliani. Mark, once called the only honest man by William F. Buckley Jr., was a life member of the National Rifle Association, a founder, general secretary and chairman of Amnesty International USA, special counsel to the Second Amendment Foundation, a genuine New Yorker, confirmed gun nut, labor lawyer, intellectual, bon vivant, and Krag Sporter expert. He was a good man and will be greatly missed. A memorial service will be held in the spring. Memorial donations may be made to the American Custom Gunmakers Guild Education Foundation, Cody, WY.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BENENSON, MARK K.

docs.snippet: BENENSON--Letizia Pitigliani. Artist Letizia Pitigliani, born November 23, 1935, of New York City, Port Murray, New Jersey and Rome, Italy, died on January 24, 2012 in Cancun, Mexico. She is survived by her son Alexander, her daughter Daniela Fifi...
docs.lead_paragraph: BENENSON--Letizia Pitigliani. Artist Letizia Pitigliani, born November 23, 1935, of New York City, Port Murray, New Jersey and Rome, Italy, died on January 24, 2012 in Cancun, Mexico. She is survived by her son Alexander, her daughter Daniela Fifi and her sister Anna Drago. Her husband Mark K. Benenson passed away on November 26 2013. Born in Rome, her family fled Italy at the beginning of WWII for New York City, to which she returned in marriage, to raise a family, and make her career as a painter. She is best known in New York City for her Harbor Festival posters from 1976-1986. Her work is found worldwide in private and public collections, and printed in hundreds of thousands of posters celebrating festivals and events big and small. Letizia Pitigliani's works can be seen at www.pitigliani.com. A memorial will be held in the spring.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BENENSON, LETIZIA PITIGLIANI
